intro: Dendranthema glabriusculum, commonly known as oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces bright yellow flowers with white ray florets, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Oxeye daisy is often found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides, and it is known for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
